messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] unschooling
messages.msgSnippet: ... Everything produced in the European Union these days is supposed to be labelled in the languages of all the EU countries.  This is a huge blessing for me,
messages.messageBody:
3/9/03 15:23:

> I live in Rochester, NY and once bought mayo that was labeled in English and
> Russian (Cyrillic alphabet).

Everything produced in the European Union these days is supposed to be
labelled in the languages of all the EU countries. This is a huge blessing
for me, because England is EU so I can now actually read the labels on
stuff! (It started in January, after I'd been here over a year struggling
along in German.)

Some labelling people go crazy and include all European languages, which
gets pretty interesting, especially on something like a chocolate bar
wrapper!

brenda

p.s. the topic label on this thread is kinda "duh" on an unschooling list,
dontcha think? :)
